title: Big Company Settles Opioid Lawsuits
summary: A judge has agreed to let Purdue Pharma settle lawsuits about opioids, which are strong pain medicines that caused many problems. Also, in Charlotte, more police are coming because the president wants to stop illegal immigration. And the government decided not to make airlines pay people when flights are delayed. This news helps us understand how companies and the government make decisions that affect everyone.

background_read: Opioids are medicines that help with pain but have caused addiction and health issues for many people. Purdue Pharma made some of these medicines and faced lawsuits. A bankruptcy court helps companies that can't pay their debts. Immigration laws control who can enter a country, and sometimes the government sends agents to enforce them. Airlines sometimes delay flights, and there were plans to make them pay passengers, but that was dropped.
Article_Structure: WHO: A federal bankruptcy judge and Purdue Pharma
WHAT: Approved a settlement for opioid lawsuits, Charlotte prepares for agents, government drops airline delay compensation plans
WHERE: In the United States, specifically in bankruptcy court and Charlotte
WHY: To resolve legal issues, enforce immigration laws, and change airline rules
